sections.title: Section 1: Regular Expression Operators and Match Patterns

questions.question: Which of the following is a key guideline when using the dot (`.`) operator in regular expressions?

options.A: Use it to match only numbers
options.B: Use it sparingly, as it matches any character
options.C: Always combine it with a plus sign
options.D: Only use it at the end of a pattern

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which regular expression operators are used to specify repetition of character classes or groups?
What is the main reason to use escape characters (backslash `\`) liberally in regular expressions?

options.A: Escapes are required for all letters
options.B: Escapes prevent special characters from being treated as operators
options.D: Escapes are only needed for digits

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** In the provided domain name pattern, which character classes are allowed in a domain label?
Why is the `\w` character class not suitable for matching domain labels in web addresses?

options.C: It includes underscores, which are not allowed in domain names

questions.question: What is the purpose of using parentheses in a regular expression pattern?

options.B: To create match groups and apply operators to sequences
options.D: To force the pattern to start at the beginning of a line

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** In the example web address pattern, which components are made optional or repeatable using regular expression operators?
What is the effect of placing a `?` after the "s" in "https?" in the protocol pattern?

options.B: It makes the "s" optional, matching both "http" and "https"

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** Why are word boundaries (`\b`) used at the start and end of the full web address pattern?

options.A: To ensure the match is a complete word or address
options.B: To prevent matching addresses with illegal characters
options.C: To restrict matches to the beginning of a line
options.D: To avoid partial matches within longer strings

questions.question: What is a practical reason for testing regular expressions at a site like regex101.com?

options.A: It automatically writes the regex for you
options.B: It provides instant feedback and highlights matches, helping you debug patterns
options.C: It only works for Python regex
options.D: It guarantees perfect matches in all programming languages
